item.title: 印度希望与日本和新加坡达成碳交易
item.description: 印度的目标是在 2025 年初与日本敲定一项潜在的碳信用协议，然后与韩国和新加坡等国推进类似的谈判。【原文：India is aiming to finalize a potential carbon credit deal with Japan early in 2025 and then advance similar negotiations with nations including South Korea and Singapore】

item.title: 世界能否团结起来，结束塑料污染危机？
item.description:
随着全球塑料条约的最后一次谈判在韩国拉开帷幕，各国在是否对这种无处不在的材料设定生产上限的问题上出现了分歧。【原文：

As the last negotiations for a global plastic treaty begin in South Korea, countries are divided over whether to cap production of the ubiquitous material. 

】

item.title: 以代价挽救 COP29 会谈的疯狂策略内幕
item.description:
为期两周的艰难谈判濒临失败，最终达成了一项价值 3,000 亿美元的协议，为气候外交的未来发出了警告。【原文：

Two weeks of difficult negotiations came to the brink of failure before settling on a $300 billion deal that flashes warnings for the future of climate diplomacy.

】

item.title: 特朗普获胜迫使华尔街一度声势浩大的一角重整旗鼓
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，迫使华尔街一个术语较多的角落重新思考其谈话要点。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is forcing one of Wall Street’s more jargon-filled corners to rethink its talking points.】

item.title: COP29: 我们学到的五件事
item.description: 在超过24小时的超时工作之后，COP29终于达成了气候融资协议。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上免费阅读我们对这一来之不易的协议的完整报道，以及我们对 COP29 的所有报道。今天，我们为您介绍峰会的五大收获。【原文：After running more than 24 hours over time, COP29 finally sealed a deal on climate finance. You can read our full story of the hard-won agreement — and all of our COP29 coverage — for free on Bloomberg.com. Today we give you our five takeaways from the summit.】

item.title: 预计感恩节一周全美将有冬季风暴
item.description: 美联社）— 美国各地的预报员发出警告说，新一轮的冬季天气可能会使感恩节假期前的旅行变得更加复杂，而加利福尼亚州和华盛顿州仍在继续从风暴破坏和停电中恢复。【原文：WINDSOR, Calif. (AP) — Forecasters through the U.S. issued warnings that another round of winter weather could complicate travel leading up to the Thanksgiving holiday, while California and Washington state continue to recover from storm damage and power outages.】

item.title: COP29: 3000 亿美元气候融资协议
item.description: 现在是巴库凌晨 3 点，COP29 峰会终于就气候融资问题达成协议，经过两周紧张的谈判，峰会的主要目标得以实现。但是，不愉快的反应已经纷至沓来。请访问 Bloomberg.com，了解我们对 COP29 的所有免费报道。【原文：It’s 3am in Baku and COP29 finally reached a deal on climate finance, accomplishing the summit’s main objective after two weeks of fraught negotiations. But unhappy reactions are already rolling in. Catch up with all of our COP29 coverage — which is free — on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: COP29 经过激烈争论后达成气候融资协议
item.description: 近 200 个国家同意将可用于帮助发展中国家应对迅速变暖的气温的资金增加两倍多。【原文：Nearly 200 countries agreed to more than triple the amount of money available to help developing countries confront rapidly warming temperatures.】

item.title: 谈判代表称，主要国家就大纲达成一致，COP29 协议指日可待
item.description: COP29 似乎将达成最后的协议，因为谈判代表们同意了一项关于资金的协议的大纲，将在阿塞拜疆举行的气候谈判从破裂的边缘拉了回来。【原文：COP29 appeared set for a last ditch deal as negotiators agreed the broad outline of a deal on finance, pulling the climate talks in Azerbaijan back from the brink of breaking down.】

item.title: 瑞士集团寻求禁止银行为化石燃料提供新融资
item.description: 据《瑞士报》（Schweiz am Wochenende）报道，一个由立法者和公众人物组成的多党团体计划发起一项倡议，以禁止瑞士金融机构为新的化石燃料开采提供资金或保险。【原文：A multi-party group of lawmakers and public figures plans to launch an initiative seeking to ban Swiss financial institutions from funding or insuring new fossil-fuel mining, newspaper Schweiz am Wochenende reported.】

item.title: 欧洲和美国寻求以 3000 亿美元报价打破 COP29 僵局
item.description: 周六下午，在阿塞拜疆巴库举行的联合国会谈上，近 200 个国家仍在闭门谈判一项新的气候融资协议。【原文：Nearly 200 nations were still negotiating a new climate finance deal behind closed doors at United Nations talks in Baku, Azerbaijan on Saturday afternoon, as the fraught talks have gone far into overtime.】

item.title: 暴风雪伯特携风雨雪袭击英国
item.description: 暴风雪 "伯特 "正以强风、暴雨和冰雪袭击该国，黄色预警即将生效，"对生命和财产构成潜在风险"。【原文：Storm Bert is battering the country with strong winds, heavy rain and snow and ice with amber warnings coming into force bringing a "potential risk to life and property".】

item.title: 暴风雨伯特带来天气警告和旅行中断
item.description: 暴风雪 "伯特 "已经开始造成影响，大雪封路，强降雨和大风预计将进一步扰乱出行，并可能引发洪水。【原文：Storm Bert has begun to make an impact with snow closing roads and strong rains and winds expected to cause further travel disruption and potential flooding.】

item.title: 特朗普已在帮助重振高校气候运动
item.description:
青年活动家们将未来四年视为他们让未来地球适宜居住的 "最后机会" 

。【原文：

Youth activists see the next four years as their “last shot” to make the future planet habitable. 

】

item.title: 暴风雪伯特将给英国带来旅行中断和洪灾
item.description: 暴风雪伯特即将袭击英国--降雪、降雨和强风预计将造成旅行中断和潜在洪灾。【原文：Storm Bert is set to strike the UK - with snow, rain and strong winds expected to cause travel disruption and potential flooding.】

item.title: COP29 接近达成碳交易，市场诚信问题迫在眉睫
item.description:
即使大的气候融资目标仍然遥遥无期，在阿塞拜疆举行的缔约方大会谈判代表们仍在推进各国之间的碳信用额交易规则。【原文：

Even as a big climate finance goal remains elusive, COP negotiators in Azerbaijan are advancing rules for carbon credits trading between countries.

】

item.title: 第二十九届缔约方会议：等待游戏
item.description: 晚上好，来自巴库。COP29 谈判正式进入超时阶段。到目前为止，我们已经看到了两份协议草案，预计周六的下一份草案将是最终版本。在您等待期间，请访问彭博网站，了解我们对 COP29 的所有免费报道。【原文：Good evening from Baku. COP29 talks have officially run into overtime. We’ve seen two drafts of the deal so far and expect the next one, promised some time on Saturday, will be the final. While you wait, catch up with all of our COP29 coverage — which is free — on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 巴西乙醇生产商因巴西国家石油公司的合资计划而反弹
item.description: 在巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）宣布正在与 "大型 "生物燃料生产商谈判成立合资企业后，包括 Raizen SA 和 Cosan SA 在内的巴西乙醇生产商纷纷上涨。【原文：Brazilian ethanol producers including Raizen SA and Cosan SA rallied after Petrobras announced that it was in talks with “large” producers of the biofuel to create a joint venture.】

item.title: 在石油之国召开的气候大会上，进展依然渺茫
item.description:
在阿塞拜疆举行的 COP29 气候大会上，认真的谈判与关于外交步伐和力量的生存问题交织在一起。【原文：

The COP29 climate conference in Azerbaijan saw earnest negotiations mix with an existential question about the pace and power of diplomacy. 

】

item.title: 中国经济放缓推动最大污染国达到排放峰值
item.description:
经济增长乏力和清洁能源的迅猛发展正共同带来全球变暖斗争的分水岭时刻。【原文：

Weaker economic growth and a surge of clean energy are combining to deliver a watershed moment in the global warming fight.

】

item.title: 纽约市的地下蒸汽系统可能是实现绿色未来的关键
item.description:
约 100 英里长的蒸汽管道蜿蜒于曼哈顿地下，为一些大牌客户提供低碳蒸汽。更多的建筑将很快接入蒸汽管道。【原文：

Some 100 miles of steam pipes snake below Manhattan, delivering low-carbon vapor to some big-name customers. More buildings could soon tap in.

】

item.title: 干旱影响水力发电，赞比亚考虑 9 亿美元煤电计划
item.description: 赞比亚正在考虑由一家中资企业建造一座耗资 9 亿美元的燃煤发电厂的计划，因为该国正在与创纪录的干旱造成的前所未有的电力短缺作斗争。【原文：Zambia is considering plans by a Chinese-owned company to build a $900 million coal-fired power plant, as it battles unprecedented electricity shortages caused by a record drought.】

item.title: COP29 峰会推动达成 2500 亿美元协议以缩小分歧
item.description: 在充满争议的谈判进入最后阶段之际，联合国 COP29 峰会推动达成一项 2,500 亿美元的国际筹资协议，以帮助贫穷国家应对气候变化，从而推动近 200 个国家达成一项协议。【原文：The UN’s COP29 summit pushed for a $250 billion international funding deal to help poor countries combat climate change, nudging almost 200 nations toward an agreement as fraught talks enter the final stretch.】

item.title: 在沙漠中冲浪需要付出气候代价
item.description:
随着人工造浪池在世界各地的兴起，冲浪公园的开发商希望通过绿色发展来抵制对能源和水资源使用的批评。【原文：

As artificial wave pools proliferate around the world, surf park developers aim to go green to counter criticism over energy and water use.

】

item.title: 北极天气导致欧洲电力和交通中断
item.description: 在北欧遭遇冬季第一场大风暴之后，冰雪天气扰乱了交通，使电网不堪重负。【原文：Snow and ice are disrupting transport and straining power grids, after the first major storms of the winter season hit northern Europe.】

item.title: 斯坦查特为巴哈马完成 3 亿美元债务转换交易
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）完成了一笔 3 亿美元的交易，这笔交易将使巴哈马能够进行债务再融资，并将节省下来的资金用于海洋保护。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc has wrapped up a $300 million deal that will allow the Bahamas to refinance debt and allocate savings to ocean conservation.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦出人意料的太阳能热潮
item.description: 早上好，我来自巴库。COP29的谈判代表们仍在努力解决如何为发展中国家提供更多国际气候融资的深刻分歧。周四的一项初步提案引发了广泛的愤怒，我们现在正处于等待协议更新的胶着状态。您可以在彭博网站（Bloomberg.com）了解最新消息以及我们对 COP29 的所有报道— 免费— 。【原文：Good morning from Baku. Negotiators at COP29 are still trying to resolve deep differences over how to scale up international climate finance for developing nations. An initial proposal on Thursday sparked widespread anger, and we’re now in a holding pattern as we wait for updates on a deal. You can catch up with the latest news and all of our COP29 coverage — for free — at Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦太阳能蓬勃发展，为数百万人带来惊喜，却对电网造成危害
item.description: 巴基斯坦尘土飞扬的农业中心地带新添了一个闪亮的亮点：一排排太阳能电池板。【原文：There’s a shiny new addition to Pakistan’s dusty agricultural heartland: rows upon rows of solar panels.】

item.title: 汤姆-斯太尔的房地产部门投资新泽西州房产
item.description: 亿万富翁汤姆-斯泰尔（Tom Steyer）的 Galvanize Climate Solutions LLC 公司的房地产部门在短短半年多的时间里进行了第三次收购，购买了新泽西州的一处房产，以建立一个以去碳化为目标的资产组合。【原文：The real estate division of billionaire Tom Steyer’s Galvanize Climate Solutions LLC has made its third acquisition in just over six months, purchasing a New Jersey property as it builds a portfolio of assets targeted for decarbonization.】

item.title: 沙特阿美首席财务官在气候抗议活动后离开波士顿附近的活动现场
item.description: 气候抗议者扰乱了麻省理工学院与沙特阿拉伯石油公司（Saudi Arabian Oil Co.首席财务官齐亚德-穆尔希德（Ziad Al-Murshed）周四在波士顿郊区举行的活动，导致这位高管离开。【原文：Climate protesters disrupted an MIT event with Saudi Arabian Oil Co. Chief Financial Officer Ziad Al-Murshed in a Boston suburb on Thursday, causing the executive to leave.】
